column5: The MSc Advanced Practice (Nursing) provides registered nurses with opportunities to expand knowledge and skills personally and professionally, to practice both autonomously and collaboratively in a defined area of advanced nursing practice, meeting national health policy reform in addressing population healthcare needs.The benefits of advanced nursing are extensively evident in both national and international literature (Department of Health 2017). The programme is in keeping with global developments in nursing, offering a career pathway for graduate nurses who meet the criteria. Further information can be found on the Nursing and Midwifery webpage - click here.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
